column5: One of these HDS radar/fishfinder/mapping units that even tells you weather and barometer.  I think one might be under the tree
I need a new gas auger, and a one man flip over hut.  My old man "took" mine when he was up here in Oct, so Im sitting on a pail in the wind, and handbombing holes for now.  S.
Got what I wanted, she got me a Mustang HX Integrity floater suit. I won't be freezin my nads off this year... Come ooooon ice!!!
Back to hard core hard water Shane.LOL  I want a  ATV,clam flip to tow and a buddy heater,and a gas auger, and,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I want Mariko Izumi for Christmas...Unwrapped is fine  Also  1 - 13' 8wt spey conversion float rod 1 - John Milner Kingfisher centerpin reel (Bushings) 1 - 9wt Sage z-axis spey rod 1 - Tibor spey series fly reel + line 2 - Plane tickets to the Skeena River (I'm sure my dad wants to go too  )  Here's hoping Santa will be generous this year...I've been a good boy this year
All I want for Christmas this year is a KILT to wear on the weekends and do my part to Free Willie Put the order in last night to a maker in BC
Lew's post was fishing related...he needs the saw to cut those hughe mucksies into steaks...  OOPS !!! Someone beat me to this but it bears repeating...
Not hard to find call salus in Waterloo and they will tell you who is selling them you will not be dissapointed
I would like a new flasher one of the hummingbirds and a couple new ice fishing rod and reels  Oh and Some ice to fish on would be excellent...

This is kinda dumb but....  What I really need is about 4 spools of Super Silver Thread "Excalibur in 6 lb test.  I used to be able to get it at LeBarons in Ottawa but Berkely has taken over----When I went to buy some there last time the Dept Mgr gave me the word on not carrying it any more---he also mentioned how he bought a bunch of it as they were clearing it out  Some wide gap Northland Shiner jigs would be cool too.  Bushart
an under water camera is on my list.  or a flasher would be nice...
Ahhhhhh yes, BBQ'd musky steaks. with a side order of swan, mmmmmm

My favourite mono as well. It's almost impossible to find anywhere. I know of one small tackle store that still has some, but at $13.99 a spool, it's pricey. Lebarons used to sell it for just over $7. I've got a couple spools of 6 & 8 lb left.  Is it even made anymore?
Looks like BPS still sells it.  I have a spool of it in 20lb as my backing on my baitcasters.
I've looked before at BPS, so it must be recently that they have started to carry it. I'll have to remember to look next time I'm there.
I got it there 2 years ago but the web site still has it listed...  call first?
I would like ice cleats for my boots for those glare ice days on the lake. Nothing is better than taking off in a sprint to get to a tripped pike line and do a complete header with a sore groin .
I'll have what Wayne wants.  Just so I can torment him by leaving it grounded. lol.  I got my gift.  It's in storage and will be unwrapped, put together and trailered home come spring.
I already peek'd... I know what it is... lol
You little devil Wayne.  Better not give away my surprise to myself. lol
I won't tell you if you don't...

I would like to receive a fishfinder (?) that i can use on my canoe next year.  Any suggestions for a newbie to fishing "on the water" as to what I should be looking for in a small unit would be appreciated. I think I want to be able to read depth of water, maybe some structure and temps too ? (Please write it in plain language as my daughter "might" be watching this for Christmas presents for me    or even post a link to the product. )   What do you want for Christmas ( Fishing related only) ?   Thanks  Splashhopper

I want this to take me to the distant fly in lakes.. anyone interested in taking up a fund on my behalf?? Always have wanted a 195.. and on floats is a rarity..     How about some Polarized Glasses???
Ice....I'd like some ice to fish on.........By Jan 1st....
I'd like  to go fishing in San Diego  :lol:
you are already there.... dohhhhhhh.. stop derailing the topic of the thread please   lol
A Salus floatation suit if I could only find one.

its off season for the tuna and sailfish down there at christmas...but there is alot to be said for the scenery outta Point Loma and jigging sand bass! seriously do it ....25$ per person bring camera ..watch out for the poison red bass looking things(yummy though) dont fight the sea lions ...youll lose!!! Makos in Mission Bay   Bot Bot- here is link for your consideration without breaking your allowance savings all on dad..dont forget to get mom a smoker for the fish he catches..  http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...3-_-22074868513   what i want for christmas is ....peace and tranquility for all!!!! PLEAH....reality ...ill take a trip on irishfields new plane
I would like to upgrade to a colour fishfinder this year. Nothing too fancy, the Lowrance C-67 ought to suffice. Jim

I'm one of those lucky guys that has just about everything I could possibly need and want very little else, but I could certainly use a new circular saw and a new Sawzall wouldn't be turned down either.  Other than that, I can't think of a single other thing I need......life is good to me.
Trying to keep this for fishing related stuff only please.

If I got a couple of 50 dollar gift cars for Bass Pro, I would probably buy about $100 dollars in lures, and probably a 6' Light Action rod for Walleye fishing in 2010.  I've got so much fishing gear, I don't really need that much.. A new boat would be nice, but that's unrealistic.
But I don't NEED anymore fishing stuff, infact I've got enuff stuff for 10 people already
I'm in pretty much the same boat lew     I think he wants the sawzall to cut up them big muskies he gets..circular, I dunno, maybe to work on a new dock for the boat.

my point exactly.... what do you "want" for fishing..... gotta be something Lew..... nobody EVER has EVERYTHING for fishing.... I am just realizing that and I have only be at it 3 years now.... it's almost as bad as my golf obsession was...lol

Well I'd love a fishing boat...but that ain't gonna happen     so probably BPS gift cards for me!  I just bought a new bait casting rod and reel so I'd probably spend the money on a new tackle bag, some tackle and maybe some stuff to get into hardwater fishing!
I would love to get a linecounting reel, or perhaps a very good pair of hook removing forceps, a digital scale, or perhaps a coupon good for a day on the water with my kids.
I want Lews stuff. All of it. But I'd settle for a spool of 100 pound test braid and maybe a few Spro Frogs. Other than that I'm good...for today at least.

With the new ice fishing season in the Kawarthas, my list is too long to type.  Got a start with an early present so far, the Eskimo QuickFish 3 pop-up ice hut. Had it set up on the deck yesterday, now it's back under the tree.  A snowmobile would be nice, but not in the cards this year. All I can hope for is good enough ice for the truck.
All I want for christmas is to get into my first steelie.......maybe one of those nice plano tackle lockers too

$100 minimum gift card for Bass Pro Shops. Believe me I will have some pictures, a new Curado, Sahara or two and some decent rods to go with them alongside tackle is on my list of goodies for the Classic in February.  A hundred or two hundred bucks off would help me out a lot this Christmas and i think the parents know that every year i get a nice gift card!
My first Tarpon and I have a good shot at it too by dec 25th.
I'd kill for one of these.
Everything!
I want my lost river rod & reel back. It had great balance and was 5 1/2' long so it went anywhere yet could handle decent sized bass.  JF
One of those nice big 2 man Clams, a flasher, and someone to cut my holes and haul the stuff
